name: Hampton Inn San Antonio Downtown (River Walk)

reviews.text: when we arrived we were allowed to check in a little more than an hour early, which most hotels that is a HUGE no no. the rooms were nice and clean, the bed was soft, and the hotel staff were very friendly, always asking how we were and if we needed anything. The breakfest was a simple layout with the usual fruit, bagels, toast, oatmeal, and they would change the hot items to something different every morning. my only complaint is that the pool is to small but I did notice a sign saying the pool would be closed starting I believe in oct. for construction so hopefully they will make it bigger. Parking was FREE not something common in San Antonio and there was ample parking so noone should go with out a space. great stay for the value.
reviews.title: nice hotel

likes.liked: — very clean and willing to bring towels or anything when you called no matter the time

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice. However, booked the room through Hotwire and pre-paid; two days after checkout, the hotel added charges. Hotel acknowledged the mistake, however, not anxious to correct.
reviews.title: Check Billing before Leaving

reviews.text: Stayed here for a convention in San Antonio. Tourist season, and a convention - so hotels were all very high. This is a very nice Hampton Inn, and with a great breakfast, and free parking (a rarity in the area).
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Overall - a great value. About a 10 minute walk to the Riverwalk and River Center Mall.
reviews.title: Good location; RvrWalk & Alamo; comfortable stay (business trip).

reviews.text: Very satisfactory hotel; I had no complaints. Great walking location for my 1st trip to SA. Did not realise how good my hotel deal was (free parking, breakfast, including to-go bags) until I came home and read reviews of other nearby hotels (high prices, pay-to-park etc). Great location for Riverwalk and Alamo. You won't need a car (but the parking is free).
reviews.title: Get what you pay for, sorta!

reviews.text: Had to stay in San Antonio for a conference in October and picked the Hampton Inn because of its location and because the other conference hotels were already booked. If you are carrying a briefcase and laptop to the convention center this can be quite a walk on a hot day. This place is convenient to the Riverwalk - not directly on it. And if you are walking from the Riverwalk at night alone it can feel a little isolated.
reviews.title: Not directly on the Riverwalk

likes.disliked: — Remoteness from the Riverwalk and convention center

reviews.text: That said, for the price, it wasn't a bad hotel. The noise levels, as mentioned in other reviews, can be annoying and the breakfast was so-so. But the room was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful and the free internet access was excellent for business travel.
reviews.title: Fine Stay

reviews.text: Not a deluxe property but cost-effective and clean.
reviews.title: Other Hamptons are better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were in San Antonio for a conference and were unable to reserve a room in one of the three conference hotels (Marriot Riverwalk, Rivercenter, and Hilton). As a result, we selected the Hampton Inn for its location, price, and the website pictures. I was a little skeptical since our only other stay at a Hamptons (in Miami - Coconut Grove) was a mediocre experience at best. To our relief, this hotel was considerably better and, overall, fine. It is clean, conveniently located to the Riverwalk and Alamo, and the rooms were pleasant. Free hot beverages 24 hours a day was nice. The free breakfast was satisfactory. The room walls were a bit thin and we could hear the people in the next room coming in at night. While we couldn't actually make out their exact conversations it was a bit annoying. Also, there is no restaurant or room service.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Comfort and cleanliness of the room. Friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.title: Average
reviews.text: I had previously stayed at the Marriot Rivercenter about ten years ago. This is not as nice but considering the difference in price we would definitely stay at this Hamptons again.
This hotel is larger and slightly more upscale than most Hampton Inns (slightly) and offers all the usual ammenities of the chain. No problems.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the best feature is the location. The Alamo is within sight of the front door, and an easy walk. You'll wish it was about a block closer to the Riverwalk, and that there were some closer restaurants, but then it would probably cost another $75 a day.
reviews.title: Outstanding experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To me, this hotel offers the kind of compromise between price and location that I'm always looking for.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: We spent a morning looking at almost all the RiverWalk hotels and then chose this one which is not really on the River Walk but is very close to everything. We booked 3 nights and were so pleased that we stayed an extra night.
reviews.title: Very Noisely

reviews.text: We often stay at Hampton Inns, and we thought this was the best one we've tried. The staff was so friendly and kind. When I mentioned in conversation to the checkout clerk that we had an early flight, the next day, she gave us 2 boxed breakfasts even though we wouldn't be staying there the night before our flight. We saw a cleaning lady stop what she was doing and get other extra cleaning equipment to clean up a spill she saw in the elevator. When we needed a certain size of cardboard box to pack something, the staff found one for us.
reviews.title: Good location 100% Gurantee

reviews.text: My husband comes to San Antonio routinely on business and I often tag along. Each time we've stayed at the downtown Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not above average

reviews.text: The positives: Facility is clean and well kept. The staff are always friendly. The free breakfast includes eggs as well as a wide variety of bagels, yogurt, cereals, fruit, etc. One of the nicest features is the coffee and tea bar available 24/7. Heating, cooling and showers work just fine.
reviews.title: Good location walk to Alamo & riverwalk

reviews.text: Another positive is the location -- just two blocks away from the Alamo and from Rivercenter Mall. There are several entrances from the mall onto the Riverwalk. The area around the hotel seems safe but as a precaution Hampton has security detail on guard at all times -- mostly, I think, to make certain only registered guests park in the parking lot.
reviews.title: Decent value play for Riverwalk area

reviews.text: The negatives: The king-sized bed is not the greatest. It sags a bit in the middle. I've slept on worse but if you have back problems, this might not be the place for you.
reviews.title: Spring Break 2007
Ideal Location
reviews.text: Also, the facility does offer free wireless internet but the connection level is very low; surfing can be frustrating. It is this slow Internet connection that's prompting us to try another facility next time, especially since we both need the Internet and e-mail for our work. This Hampton does not offer direct modem access.

aka: Hampton Inn San Antonio Downtown (River Walk) Hotel
description: Located just blocks from the River Walk, the Convention Center and the Alamo, the Hampton Inn San Antonio-Downtown (River Walk) is ten minutes from the San Antonio International Airport. Settle into a comfortable guest room with thoughtful amenities for work and relaxation. Enjoy free high-speed internet access, type away on the handy lap desk or curl up in front of the in-room TV. Start the day right with Hampton's free hot breakfast. Stay connected on the lobby computer with free high-speed internet, fax and photocopying. Enjoy a workout in the fitness center or swim in the pool.
